001package imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.chew;
002
003import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
004

014/**
015 * Points in Euclidean space, implemented as double[].
016 *
017 * Includes simple geometric operations.
018 * Uses matrices; a matrix is represented as an array of Pnts.
019 * Uses simplices; a simplex is represented as an array of Pnts.
020 *
021 * @author Paul Chew
022 *
023 * Created July 2005.  Derived from an earlier, messier version.
024 *
025 * Modified Novemeber 2007.  Minor clean up.
026 * 
027 * Adapted by W. Burger (2019)
028 * @version 2020-01-01
029 * 
030 */
031public class Pnt implements Pnt2d {
032
033    private double[] coordinates;          // The point's coordinates
034    
035    public Pnt(Pnt2d p) {
036        this(p.getX(), p.getY());
037    }
038    
039
040    /**
041     * Constructor.
042     * @param coords the coordinates
043     */
044    public Pnt (double... coords) {
045        // Copying is done here to ensure that Pnt's coords cannot be altered.
046        // This is necessary because the double... notation actually creates a
047        // constructor with double[] as its argument.
048        //        coordinates = new double[coords.length];
049        //        System.arraycopy(coords, 0, coordinates, 0, coords.length);
050        coordinates = coords.clone();
051    }
052    
053    // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
054
055    @Override
056    public String toString () {
057        if (coordinates.length == 0) return "Pnt()";
058        String result = "Pnt(" + coordinates[0];
059        for (int i = 1; i < coordinates.length; i++)
060            result = result + "," + coordinates[i];
061        result = result + ")";
062        return result;
063    }
064
065    @Override
066    public boolean equals (Object other) {
067        if (!(other instanceof Pnt)) return false;
068        Pnt p = (Pnt) other;
069        if (this.coordinates.length != p.coordinates.length) return false;
070        for (int i = 0; i < this.coordinates.length; i++)
071            if (this.coordinates[i] != p.coordinates[i]) return false;
072        return true;
073    }
074
075    @Override
076    public int hashCode () {
077        int hash = 0;
078        for (double c: this.coordinates) {
079            long bits = java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(c);
080            hash = (31*hash) ^ (int)(bits ^ (bits >> 32));
081        }
082        return hash;
083    }
084
085    /* Pnts as vectors */
086
087    /**
088     * Returns the specified coordinate of this point/vector.
089     * @param i the coordinate index (0, 1, ...)
090     * @return as described
091     */
092    public double coord (int i) {
093        return this.coordinates[i];
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * @return this Pnt's dimension.
098     */
099    public int dimension () {
100        return coordinates.length;
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * Check that dimensions match.
105     * @param p the Pnt to check (against this Pnt)
106     * @return the dimension of the Pnts
107     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if dimension fail to match
108     */
109    public int dimCheck (Pnt p) {
110        int len = this.coordinates.length;
111        if (len != p.coordinates.length)
112            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Dimension mismatch");
113        return len;
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Create a new Pnt by adding additional coordinates to this Pnt.
118     * @param coords the new coordinates (added on the right end)
119     * @return a new Pnt with the additional coordinates
120     */
121    public Pnt extend (double... coords) {
122        double[] result = new double[coordinates.length + coords.length];
123        System.arraycopy(coordinates, 0, result, 0, coordinates.length);
124        System.arraycopy(coords, 0, result, coordinates.length, coords.length);
125        return new Pnt(result);
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Dot product.
130     * @param p the other Pnt
131     * @return dot product of this Pnt and p
132     */
133    public double dot (Pnt p) {
134        int len = dimCheck(p);
135        double sum = 0;
136        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++)
137            sum += this.coordinates[i] * p.coordinates[i];
138        return sum;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Magnitude (as a vector).
143     * @return the Euclidean length of this vector
144     */
145    public double magnitude () {
146        return Math.sqrt(this.dot(this));
147    }
148
149    /**
150     * Subtract.
151     * @param p the other Pnt
152     * @return a new Pnt = this - p
153     */
154    public Pnt subtract (Pnt p) {
155        int len = dimCheck(p);
156        double[] coords = new double[len];
157        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++)
158            coords[i] = this.coordinates[i] - p.coordinates[i];
159        return new Pnt(coords);
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Add.
164     * @param p the other Pnt
165     * @return a new Pnt = this + p
166     */
167    public Pnt add (Pnt p) {
168        int len = dimCheck(p);
169        double[] coords = new double[len];
170        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++)
171            coords[i] = this.coordinates[i] + p.coordinates[i];
172        return new Pnt(coords);
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * Angle (in radians) between two Pnts (treated as vectors).
177     * @param p the other Pnt
178     * @return the angle (in radians) between the two Pnts
179     */
180    public double angle (Pnt p) {
181        return Math.acos(this.dot(p) / (this.magnitude() * p.magnitude()));
182    }
183
184    /**
185     * Perpendicular bisector of two Pnts.
186     * Works in any dimension.  The coefficients are returned as a Pnt of one
187     * higher dimension (e.g., (A,B,C,D) for an equation of the form
188     * Ax + By + Cz + D = 0).
189     * @param point the other point
190     * @return the coefficients of the perpendicular bisector
191     */
192    public Pnt bisector (Pnt point) {
193        dimCheck(point);
194        Pnt diff = this.subtract(point);
195        Pnt sum = this.add(point);
196        double dot = diff.dot(sum);
197        return diff.extend(-dot / 2);
198    }
199
200    /* Pnts as matrices */
201
202    /**
203     * Create a String for a matrix.
204     * @param matrix the matrix (an array of Pnts)
205     * @return a String represenation of the matrix
206     */
207    public static String toString (Pnt[] matrix) {
208        StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder("{");
209        for (Pnt row: matrix) buf.append(" " + row);
210        buf.append(" }");
211        return buf.toString();
212    }
213
214    /**
215     * Compute the determinant of a matrix (array of Pnts).
216     * This is not an efficient implementation, but should be adequate
217     * for low dimension.
218     * @param matrix the matrix as an array of Pnts
219     * @return the determinnant of the input matrix
220     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if dimensions are wrong
221     */
222    public static double determinant (Pnt[] matrix) {
223        if (matrix.length != matrix[0].dimension())
224            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Matrix is not square");
225        boolean[] columns = new boolean[matrix.length];
226        for (int i = 0; i < matrix.length; i++) columns[i] = true;
227        try {return determinant(matrix, 0, columns);}
228        catch (ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException e) {
229            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Matrix is wrong shape");
230        }
231    }
232
233    /**
234     * Compute the determinant of a submatrix specified by starting row
235     * and by "active" columns.
236     * @param matrix the matrix as an array of Pnts
237     * @param row the starting row
238     * @param columns a boolean array indicating the "active" columns
239     * @return the determinant of the specified submatrix
240     * @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if dimensions are wrong
241     */
242    private static double determinant(Pnt[] matrix, int row, boolean[] columns){
243        if (row == matrix.length) return 1;
244        double sum = 0;
245        int sign = 1;
246        for (int col = 0; col < columns.length; col++) {
247            if (!columns[col]) continue;
248            columns[col] = false;
249            sum += sign * matrix[row].coordinates[col] *
250                   determinant(matrix, row+1, columns);
251            columns[col] = true;
252            sign = -sign;
253        }
254        return sum;
255    }
256
257    /**
258     * Compute generalized cross-product of the rows of a matrix.
259     * The result is a Pnt perpendicular (as a vector) to each row of
260     * the matrix.  This is not an efficient implementation, but should
261     * be adequate for low dimension.
262     * @param matrix the matrix of Pnts (one less row than the Pnt dimension)
263     * @return a Pnt perpendicular to each row Pnt
264     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if matrix is wrong shape
265     */
266    public static Pnt cross (Pnt[] matrix) {
267        int len = matrix.length + 1;
268        if (len != matrix[0].dimension())
269            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Dimension mismatch");
270        boolean[] columns = new boolean[len];
271        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) columns[i] = true;
272        double[] result = new double[len];
273        int sign = 1;
274        try {
275            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
276                columns[i] = false;
277                result[i] = sign * determinant(matrix, 0, columns);
278                columns[i] = true;
279                sign = -sign;
280            }
281        } catch (ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException e) {
282            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Matrix is wrong shape");
283        }
284        return new Pnt(result);
285    }
286
287    /* Pnts as simplices */
288
289    /**
290     * Determine the signed content (i.e., area or volume, etc.) of a simplex.
291     * @param simplex the simplex (as an array of Pnts)
292     * @return the signed content of the simplex
293     */
294    public static double content (Pnt[] simplex) {
295        Pnt[] matrix = new Pnt[simplex.length];
296        for (int i = 0; i < matrix.length; i++)
297            matrix[i] = simplex[i].extend(1);
298        int fact = 1;
299        for (int i = 1; i < matrix.length; i++) fact = fact*i;
300        return determinant(matrix) / fact;
301    }
302
303    /**
304     * Relation between this Pnt and a simplex (represented as an array of
305     * Pnts). Result is an array of signs, one for each vertex of the simplex,
306     * indicating the relation between the vertex, the vertex's opposite facet,
307     * and this Pnt.
308     * Throws a {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the simplex is degenerate.
309     *
310     * <pre>
311     *   -1 means Pnt is on same side of facet
312     *    0 means Pnt is on the facet
313     *   +1 means Pnt is on opposite side of facet
314     * </pre>
315     *
316     * @param simplex an array of Pnts representing a simplex
317     * @return an array of signs showing relation between this Pnt and simplex
318     */
319    public int[] relation (Pnt[] simplex) {
320        /* In 2D, we compute the cross of this matrix:
321         *    1   1   1   1
322         *    p0  a0  b0  c0
323         *    p1  a1  b1  c1
324         * where (a, b, c) is the simplex and p is this Pnt. The result is a
325         * vector in which the first coordinate is the signed area (all signed
326         * areas are off by the same constant factor) of the simplex and the
327         * remaining coordinates are the *negated* signed areas for the
328         * simplices in which p is substituted for each of the vertices.
329         * Analogous results occur in higher dimensions.
330         */
331        int dim = simplex.length - 1;
332        if (this.dimension() != dim)
333            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Dimension mismatch");
334
335        /* Create and load the matrix */
336        Pnt[] matrix = new Pnt[dim+1];
337        /* First row */
338        double[] coords = new double[dim+2];
339        for (int j = 0; j < coords.length; j++) coords[j] = 1;
340        matrix[0] = new Pnt(coords);
341        /* Other rows */
342        for (int i = 0; i < dim; i++) {
343            coords[0] = this.coordinates[i];
344            for (int j = 0; j < simplex.length; j++)
345                coords[j+1] = simplex[j].coordinates[i];
346            matrix[i+1] = new Pnt(coords);
347        }
348
349        /* Compute and analyze the vector of areas/volumes/contents */
350        Pnt vector = cross(matrix);
351        double content = vector.coordinates[0];
352        int[] result = new int[dim+1];
353        for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++) {
354            double value = vector.coordinates[i+1];
355            if (Math.abs(value) <= 1.0e-6 * Math.abs(content)) result[i] = 0;
356            else if (value < 0) result[i] = -1;
357            else result[i] = 1;
358        }
359        if (content < 0) {
360            for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++)
361                result[i] = -result[i];
362        }
363        if (content == 0) {
364            for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++)
365                result[i] = Math.abs(result[i]);
366        }
367        return result;
368    }
369
370    /**
371     * Test if this Pnt is outside of simplex.
372     * @param simplex the simplex (an array of Pnts)
373     * @return simplex Pnt that "witnesses" outsideness (or null if not outside)
374     */
375    public Pnt isOutside (Pnt[] simplex) {
376        int[] result = this.relation(simplex);
377        for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++) {
378            if (result[i] > 0) return simplex[i];
379        }
380        return null;
381    }
382
383    /**
384     * Test if this Pnt is on a simplex.
385     * @param simplex the simplex (an array of Pnts)
386     * @return the simplex Pnt that "witnesses" on-ness (or null if not on)
387     */
388    public Pnt isOn (Pnt[] simplex) {
389        int[] result = this.relation(simplex);
390        Pnt witness = null;
391        for (int i = 0; i < result.length; i++) {
392            if (result[i] == 0) witness = simplex[i];
393            else if (result[i] > 0) return null;
394        }
395        return witness;
396    }
397
398    /**
399     * Test if this Pnt is inside a simplex.
400     * @param simplex the simplex (an arary of Pnts)
401     * @return true iff this Pnt is inside simplex.
402     */
403    public boolean isInside (Pnt[] simplex) {
404        int[] result = this.relation(simplex);
405        for (int r: result) if (r >= 0) return false;
406        return true;
407    }
408
409    /**
410     * Test relation between this Pnt and circumcircle of a simplex.
411     * @param simplex the simplex (as an array of Pnts)
412     * @return -1, 0, or +1 for inside, on, or outside of circumcircle
413     */
414    public int vsCircumcircle (Pnt[] simplex) {
415        Pnt[] matrix = new Pnt[simplex.length + 1];
416        for (int i = 0; i < simplex.length; i++)
417            matrix[i] = simplex[i].extend(1, simplex[i].dot(simplex[i]));
418        matrix[simplex.length] = this.extend(1, this.dot(this));
419        double d = determinant(matrix);
420        int result = (d < 0)? -1 : ((d > 0)? +1 : 0);
421        if (content(simplex) < 0) result = - result;
422        return result;
423    }
424
425    /**
426     * Circumcenter of a simplex.
427     * @param simplex the simplex (as an array of Pnts)
428     * @return the circumcenter (a Pnt) of simplex
429     */
430    public static Pnt circumcenter (Pnt[] simplex) {
431        int dim = simplex[0].dimension();
432        if (simplex.length - 1 != dim)
433            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Dimension mismatch");
434        Pnt[] matrix = new Pnt[dim];
435        for (int i = 0; i < dim; i++)
436            matrix[i] = simplex[i].bisector(simplex[i+1]);
437        Pnt hCenter = cross(matrix);      // Center in homogeneous coordinates
438        double last = hCenter.coordinates[dim];
439        double[] result = new double[dim];
440        for (int i = 0; i < dim; i++) result[i] = hCenter.coordinates[i] / last;
441        return new Pnt(result);
442    }
443    
444    // methods required by {@link Point}:
445
446        @Override
447        public double getX() {
448                return this.coordinates[0];
449        }
450
451        @Override
452        public double getY() {
453                return this.coordinates[1];
454        }
455
